name: Hellenistic Culture

civilopediaText.text: Following the collapse of the short lived Argead Empire, many new dynasties emerged in the former Macedonian and Persian territories. All sharing some degree of Hellenic culture and Macedonian military organization, they intermarried and fought each other until the eventual Roman conquest in the following centuries.

uniques: Only available <after adopting [Hellenistic Culture]> <hidden from users>
[+25]% Production when constructing [Settler] units [in all cities]
[Cavalry] units gain the [Armored Lancer] promotion <for [The Mithridatids] Civilizations> <hidden from users>
[Cavalry] units gain the [Armored Lancer] promotion <for [The Seleucids] Civilizations> <hidden from users>
[Cavalry] units gain the [Lancer] promotion <for [The Epirots] Civilizations> <hidden from users>
[Cavalry] units gain the [Lancer] promotion <for [The Macedonians] Civilizations> <hidden from users>

Provides [1] [Enable Chariot Archer] <for [The Ptolemies] Civilizations> <hidden from users>

policies.name: Ktistes

civilopediaText.text: Ktistes was a hellenestic royal epithet meaning The Builder, or founder of cities. Most dynasties founded at least several cities, usually named after the ruler or one of their relatives.

uniques: Each city founded increases culture cost of policies [33]% less than normal

policies.name: Euergetes

civilopediaText.text: Euergetes was a common hellenestic royal epithet meaning The Benefactor. Most famous of the philanthropists was Ptolemy III.

uniques: Gifts of Gold to City-States generate [+25]% more Influence

policies.name: The Grand Fleet

civilopediaText.text: Hellenistic States often build massive fleets of large warships.

uniques: [+15]% Production when constructing [Ranged Water] units [in all cities]

policies.name: Military Colonies

civilopediaText.text: Usually ruling over mostly foreign subjects, hellenistic dynasts in Egypt and Asia constantly tried to attract Macedonians and Greeks as military settlers to form the core of their armies.

uniques: New [{Melee} {Land}] units start with [10] XP [in all cities] <in cities with a [Colony]>
[+2 Happiness] [in annexed cities] <in cities with a [Colony]>

policies.name: Nikator

civilopediaText.text: Nikator was a hellenestic royal epithet meaning The Victorious. Most famous of the victors was Seleucos I.

uniques: Upon capturing a city, receive [5] times its [Culture] production as [Culture] immediately

policies.name: Megas

civilopediaText.text: Megas was a hellenestic royal epithet meaning The Great. Alexander III, Antiochos III and Mithridates VI were the Greats.

uniques: [+50]% XP gained from combat <for [Melee] units> <when adjacent to a [General] unit>
[+50]% XP gained from combat <for [Melee] units> <when adjacent to a [King] unit>

civilopediaText.text: Soter was a common hellenestic royal epithet meaning The Savior. Most famous of the saviours was Ptolemy I.
Poliorketes was a hellenestic royal epithet meaning The Besieger, given to Demetrios to mock his impressive but failed siege of Rhodes.
